attributes.action: Introduce a 20mphr speed zone & double yellow lines around Huntingtree Primary
attributes.additional_details: Hayley Green is home to Huntingtree Primary & Lutley Primary, both are in very close proximity. There is currently no 20mphr speed limit or double yellows on Huntingtree Rd nor the surrounding streets, & people attending the schools are often seen speeding, & parking dangerously. Often cars are parked opposite T-junctions, on grass verges & on corners. Children are coming to & from school surrounded by chaos, how long must we wait for these critical life saving restrictions to be put in place?
attributes.background: In March 2017 I was involved in a collision on Huntingtree Road due to a speeding vehicle and other cars parked dangerously. The impact caused my car to be written off, but thankfully nobody was seriously hurt.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The speed limit and double yellow lines around Huntingtree Primary is the responsibility of the local council.

You can find out which local authority is responsible using a postcode and this website: https://www.gov.uk/request-speed-limit-change  

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
